node.title: How a Canberra program is saving lives by empowering the loved ones of opioid users
node.alt: A man wearing a purple shirt smiles at the camera
node.description: After combating his own addiction, one Canberra man is empowering the families of those with opioid addictions â€” and his program is saving lives.
node.content:
["David Baxter has witnessed the effects of overdose firsthand.\u00a0", "\"I\u00a0was living in a share house with a guy whose girlfriend was a dealer, we had a lot of people coming around the place, using heroin and using ice around the house,\" he said.", "\"There were quite a few occasions that I had to save people.\"", "Mr Baxter\u00a0used drugs for much of his adult life, and since breaking his own addiction, has dedicated his career to helping loved ones of drug users.", "Mr Baxter is the lead trainer for the Canberra Alliance for Harm Minimisation and Advocacy's (CAHMA) naloxone program.", "The program is funded by the ACT government, and\u00a0supplies the family and friends of opioid drug users with the rapid reversal medication\u00a0naloxone.\u00a0", "", "
The ACT government funds the naloxone program, helping save those who suffer from opioid overdose.(ABC News: Ian Cutmore)
", "Naloxone works by blocking receptors that the opioid would otherwise attach to.", "It was first trialled in the ACT in 2012, when 200 people were given kits with the medication.", "Within\u00a0the first six months of the program, up to 40 people said they\u00a0had used their kits.", "And, in the 12 months to June 2021, more than 320 Canberrans were given take-home naloxone.", "New research released by the Burnet Institute last week found making the reversal medication freely available across Australia and free of charge would save hundreds of lives.", "It found most opioid deaths in Australia involved prescription opioids \u2014\u00a0used by 3 million Australians.", "The study found that scaling up the take-home naloxone program to include other states, and reaching 90 per cent of people who were prescribed medium and high opioids would save over 650 lives.", "", "
Naloxone intranasal spray is used to reverse the effects of an opioid overdose.(ABC News: Antoinette Radford)
", "In Canberra, more than 70 people presented to Canberra Hospital for opioid-related overdoses last year, and more than 50 people had presented up to October this year.", "Mr Baxter said there was a high demand for people to join the program he runs, but attendees were predominantly from the north of Canberra.", "\"One of the problems with Canberra having not all that large of a population, but spread out over a large area... we have a lot more clients from the inner-north and Belconnen than we do from Weston Creek and Tuggeranong, for instance,\" he said.", "According to Australia's Annual Overdose Report 2020, 99.5 per cent\u00a0of drug-induced deaths involved an opioid drug in 2019.", "But Mr Baxter said it was not just heroin users dying from overdose.", "
'It's often at home where people find them overdosed'
", "", "
Tony Trimingham\u00a0is the CEO of the organisation Family Drug Support.\u00a0(Supplied)
", "For Tony Trimingham, the CEO and founder of Family Drug Support,\u00a0the naloxone program is a welcome way to empower loved ones of drug users.", "Mr Trimingham lost his son, Damien, to heroin overdose and has since dedicated his life to helping others in a similar situation.", "\"The fact that it's now being distributed throughout Australia, and particularly now in the ACT \u2013 I'm really in favour of it,\" he said.", "He said many family members felt helpless when they had\u00a0a loved one experiencing addiction, and educating families could help\u00a0prevent overdose-related deaths.", "\"A lot of people use drugs at home, and it's often at home where people find them overdosed or unconscious, and if they've got naloxone on hand then there's a very good chance that the person will be saved,\" he said.", "ANU Associate Professor Anna Olsen also echoed those\u00a0sentiments.\u00a0", "She said that other states in Australia with naloxone programs focused on opioid users, rather than the friends and family of users, and commended the focus\u00a0taken by CAHMA.", "\"The inclusion of family members can be really useful and empowering to both the person and their family members,\" she said."]
